summary.long: Luke is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Inasmuch as many have undertaken to compile a narrative of the things that have been accomplished among us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and ministers of the word have delivered them to us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it seemed good to me also, having followed all things closely for some time past, to write an orderly account for you, most excellent Theophilus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you may have certainty concerning the things you have been taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the days of Herod, king of Judea, there was a priest named Zechariah, of the division of Abijah. And he had a wife from the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were both righteous before God, walking blamelessly in all the commandments and statutes of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and both were advanced in years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while he was serving as priest before God when his division was on duty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: according to the custom of the priesthood, he was chosen by lot to enter the temple of the Lord and burn incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole multitude of the people were praying outside at the hour of incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there appeared to him an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar of incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zechariah was troubled when he saw him, and fear fell upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel said to him, “Do not be afraid, Zechariah, for your prayer has been heard, and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you shall call his name John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will have joy and gladness, and many will rejoice at his birth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he will be great before the Lord. And he must not drink wine or strong drink, and he will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother's womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord their God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he will go before him in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just, to make ready for the Lord a people prepared.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zechariah said to the angel, “How shall I know this? For I am an old man, and my wife is advanced in years.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel answered him, “I am Gabriel. I stand in the presence of God, and I was sent to speak to you and to bring you this good news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, you will be silent and unable to speak until the day that these things take place, because you did not believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people were waiting for Zechariah, and they were wondering at his delay in the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came out, he was unable to speak to them, and they realized that he had seen a vision in the temple. And he kept making signs to them and remained mute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his time of service was ended, he went to his home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these days his wife Elizabeth conceived, and for five months she kept herself hidden, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus the Lord has done for me in the days when he looked on me, to take away my reproach among people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city of Galilee named Nazareth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to a virgin betrothed to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David. And the virgin's name was Mary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to her and said, “Greetings, O favored one, the Lord is with you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she was greatly troubled at the saying, and tried to discern what sort of greeting this might be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And behold, you will conceive in your womb and bear a son, and you shall call his name Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High. And the Lord God will give to him the throne of his father David,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and he will reign over the house of Jacob forever, and of his kingdom there will be no end.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary said to the angel, “How will this be, since I am a virgin?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel answered her, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you; therefore the child to be born will be called holy—the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And behold, your relative Elizabeth in her old age has also conceived a son, and this is the sixth month with her who was called barren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nothing will be impossible with God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary said, “Behold, I am the servant of the Lord; let it be to me according to your word.” And the angel departed from her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days Mary arose and went with haste into the hill country, to a town in Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she entered the house of Zechariah and greeted Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Elizabeth heard the greeting of Mary, the baby leaped in her womb. And Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she exclaimed with a loud cry, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why is this granted to me that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, when the sound of your greeting came to my ears, the baby in my womb leaped for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And blessed is she who believed that there would be a fulfillment of what was spoken to her from the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Mary said,
“My soul magnifies the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and my spirit rejoices in God my Savior,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he has looked on the humble estate of his servant.
    For behold, from now on all generations will call me blessed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he who is mighty has done great things for me,
    and holy is his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And his mercy is for those who fear him
    from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has shown strength with his arm;
    he has scattered the proud in the thoughts of their hearts;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he has brought down the mighty from their thrones
    and exalted those of humble estate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he has filled the hungry with good things,
    and the rich he has sent away empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has helped his servant Israel,
    in remembrance of his mercy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
as he spoke to our fathers,
    to Abraham and to his offspring forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary remained with her about three months and returned to her home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the time came for Elizabeth to give birth, and she bore a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown great mercy to her, and they rejoiced with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child. And they would have called him Zechariah after his father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but his mother answered, “No; he shall be called John.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to her, “None of your relatives is called by this name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made signs to his father, inquiring what he wanted him to be called.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he asked for a writing tablet and wrote, “His name is John.” And they all wondered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately his mouth was opened and his tongue loosed, and he spoke, blessing God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fear came on all their neighbors. And all these things were talked about through all the hill country of Judea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all who heard them laid them up in their hearts, saying, “What then will this child be?” For the hand of the Lord was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed be the Lord God of Israel,
    for he has visited and redeemed his people
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and has raised up a horn of salvation for us
    in the house of his servant David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as he spoke by the mouth of his holy prophets from of old,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that we should be saved from our enemies
    and from the hand of all who hate us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to show the mercy promised to our fathers
    and to remember his holy covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the oath that he swore to our father Abraham, to grant us
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that we, being delivered from the hand of our enemies,
might serve him without fear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in holiness and righteousness before him all our days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you, child, will be called the prophet of the Most High;
    for you will go before the Lord to prepare his ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to give knowledge of salvation to his people
    in the forgiveness of their sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because of the tender mercy of our God,
    whereby the sunrise shall visit us from on high
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to give light to those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death,
    to guide our feet into the way of peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the child grew and became strong in spirit, and he was in the wilderness until the day of his public appearance to Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be registered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the first registration when Quirinius was governor of Syria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all went to be registered, each to his own town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph also went up from Galilee, from the town of Nazareth, to Judea, to the city of David, which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and lineage of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to be registered with Mary, his betrothed, who was with child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they were there, the time came for her to give birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she gave birth to her firstborn son and wrapped him in swaddling cloths and laid him in a manger, because there was no place for them in the inn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the same region there were shepherds out in the field, keeping watch over their flock by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an angel of the Lord appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were filled with great fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel said to them, “Fear not, for behold, I bring you good news of great joy that will be for all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For unto you is born this day in the city of David a Savior, who is Christ the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this will be a sign for you: you will find a baby wrapped in swaddling cloths and lying in a manger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Glory to God in the highest,
    and on earth peace among those with whom he is pleased!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the angels went away from them into heaven, the shepherds said to one another, “Let us go over to Bethlehem and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has made known to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went with haste and found Mary and Joseph, and the baby lying in a manger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they saw it, they made known the saying that had been told them concerning this child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who heard it wondered at what the shepherds told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Mary treasured up all these things, pondering them in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all they had heard and seen, as it had been told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the end of eight days, when he was circumcised, he was called Jesus, the name given by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the time came for their purification according to the Law of Moses, they brought him up to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (as it is written in the Law of the Lord, “Every male who first opens the womb shall be called holy to the Lord”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to offer a sacrifice according to what is said in the Law of the Lord, “a pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a man in Jerusalem, whose name was Simeon, and this man was righteous and devout, waiting for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not see death before he had seen the Lord's Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came in the Spirit into the temple, and when the parents brought in the child Jesus, to do for him according to the custom of the Law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he took him up in his arms and blessed God and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Lord, now you are letting your servant depart in peace,
    according to your word;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for my eyes have seen your salvation
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you have prepared in the presence of all peoples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a light for revelation to the Gentiles,
    and for glory to your people Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his father and his mother marveled at what was said about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simeon blessed them and said to Mary his mother, “Behold, this child is appointed for the fall and rising of many in Israel, and for a sign that is opposed
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (and a sword will pierce through your own soul also), so that thoughts from many hearts may be revealed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a prophetess, Anna, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was advanced in years, having lived with her husband seven years from when she was a virgin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then as a widow until she was eighty-four. She did not depart from the temple, worshiping with fasting and prayer night and day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And coming up at that very hour she began to give thanks to God and to speak of him to all who were waiting for the redemption of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had performed everything according to the Law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own town of Nazareth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the child grew and became strong, filled with wisdom. And the favor of God was upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the Feast of the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was twelve years old, they went up according to custom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the feast was ended, as they were returning, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem. His parents did not know it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but supposing him to be in the group they went a day's journey, but then they began to search for him among their relatives and acquaintances,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they did not find him, they returned to Jerusalem, searching for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After three days they found him in the temple, sitting among the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who heard him were amazed at his understanding and his answers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his parents saw him, they were astonished. And his mother said to him, “Son, why have you treated us so? Behold, your father and I have been searching for you in great distress.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Why were you looking for me? Did you not know that I must be in my Father's house?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And they did not understand the saying that he spoke to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went down with them and came to Nazareth and was submissive to them. And his mother treasured up all these things in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus increased in wisdom and in stature and in favor with God and man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of the region of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: during the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John the son of Zechariah in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went into all the region around the Jordan, proclaiming a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet,
“The voice of one crying in the wilderness:
‘Prepare the way of the Lord,
    make his paths straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every valley shall be filled,
    and every mountain and hill shall be made low,
and the crooked shall become straight,
    and the rough places shall become level ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all flesh shall see the salvation of God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said therefore to the crowds that came out to be baptized by him, “You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bear fruits in keeping with repentance. And do not begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I tell you, God is able from these stones to raise up children for Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even now the axe is laid to the root of the trees. Every tree therefore that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the crowds asked him, “What then shall we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered them, “Whoever has two tunics is to share with him who has none, and whoever has food is to do likewise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tax collectors also came to be baptized and said to him, “Teacher, what shall we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Collect no more than you are authorized to do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soldiers also asked him, “And we, what shall we do?” And he said to them, “Do not extort money from anyone by threats or by false accusation, and be content with your wages.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the people were in expectation, and all were questioning in their hearts concerning John, whether he might be the Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered them all, saying, “I baptize you with water, but he who is mightier than I is coming, the strap of whose sandals I am not worthy to untie. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His winnowing fork is in his hand, to clear his threshing floor and to gather the wheat into his barn, but the chaff he will burn with unquenchable fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So with many other exhortations he preached good news to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Herod the tetrarch, who had been reproved by him for Herodias, his brother's wife, and for all the evil things that Herod had done,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: added this to them all, that he locked up John in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when all the people were baptized, and when Jesus also had been baptized and was praying, the heavens were opened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Holy Spirit descended on him in bodily form, like a dove; and a voice came from heaven, “You are my beloved Son; with you I am well pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, when he began his ministry, was about thirty years of age, being the son (as was supposed) of Joseph, the son of Heli,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Josech, the son of Joda,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmadam, the son of Er,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Joshua, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonam, the son of Eliakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Melea, the son of Menna, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Sala, the son of Nahshon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Amminadab, the son of Admin, the son of Arni, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalaleel, the son of Cainan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Enos, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led by the Spirit in the wilderness
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for forty days, being tempted by the devil. And he ate nothing during those days. And when they were ended, he was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command this stone to become bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered him, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the devil took him up and showed him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, “To you I will give all this authority and their glory, for it has been delivered to me, and I give it to whom I will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you, then, will worship me, it will all be yours.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Jesus answered him, “It is written,
“‘You shall worship the Lord your God,
    and him only shall you serve.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he took him to Jerusalem and set him on the pinnacle of the temple and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down from here,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
and
“‘On their hands they will bear you up,
    lest you strike your foot against a stone.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered him, “It is said, ‘You shall not put the Lord your God to the test.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when the devil had ended every temptation, he departed from him until an opportune time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit to Galilee, and a report about him went out through all the surrounding country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he taught in their synagogues, being glorified by all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up. And as was his custom, he went to the synagogue on the Sabbath day, and he stood up to read.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scroll of the prophet Isaiah was given to him. He unrolled the scroll and found the place where it was written,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Spirit of the Lord is upon me,
    because he has anointed me
    to proclaim good news to the poor.
He has sent me to proclaim liberty to the captives
    and recovering of sight to the blind,
    to set at liberty those who are oppressed,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: to proclaim the year of the Lord's favor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he rolled up the scroll and gave it back to the attendant and sat down. And the eyes of all in the synagogue were fixed on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to say to them, “Today this Scripture has been fulfilled in your hearing.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And all spoke well of him and marveled at the gracious words that were coming from his mouth. And they said, “Is not this Joseph's son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Doubtless you will quote to me this proverb, ‘“Physician, heal yourself.” What we have heard you did at Capernaum, do here in your hometown as well.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he said, “Truly, I say to you, no prophet is acceptable in his hometown.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But in truth, I tell you, there were many widows in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the heavens were shut up three years and six months, and a great famine came over all the land,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and Elijah was sent to none of them but only to Zarephath, in the land of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And there were many lepers in Israel in the time of the prophet Elisha, and none of them was cleansed, but only Naaman the Syrian.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When they heard these things, all in the synagogue were filled with wrath.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And they rose up and drove him out of the town and brought him to the brow of the hill on which their town was built, so that they could throw him down the cliff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But passing through their midst, he went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee. And he was teaching them on the Sabbath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were astonished at his teaching, for his word possessed authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the synagogue there was a man who had the spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried out with a loud voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ha! What have you to do with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be silent and come out of him!” And when the demon had thrown him down in their midst, he came out of him, having done him no harm.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And they were all amazed and said to one another, “What is this word? For with authority and power he commands the unclean spirits, and they come out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And reports about him went out into every place in the surrounding region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he arose and left the synagogue and entered Simon's house. Now Simon's mother-in-law was ill with a high fever, and they appealed to him on her behalf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he stood over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her, and immediately she rose and began to serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the sun was setting, all those who had any who were sick with various diseases brought them to him, and he laid his hands on every one of them and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And demons also came out of many, crying, “You are the Son of God!” But he rebuked them and would not allow them to speak, because they knew that he was the Christ.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when it was day, he departed and went into a desolate place. And the people sought him and came to him, and would have kept him from leaving them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he said to them, “I must preach the good news of the kingdom of God to the other towns as well; for I was sent for this purpose.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he was preaching in the synagogues of Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On one occasion, while the crowd was pressing in on him to hear the word of God, he was standing by the lake of Gennesaret,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saw two boats by the lake, but the fishermen had gone out of them and were washing their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Getting into one of the boats, which was Simon's, he asked him to put out a little from the land. And he sat down and taught the people from the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Put out into the deep and let down your nets for a catch.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simon answered, “Master, we toiled all night and took nothing! But at your word I will let down the nets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had done this, they enclosed a large number of fish, and their nets were breaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They signaled to their partners in the other boat to come and help them. And they came and filled both the boats, so that they began to sink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus' knees, saying, “Depart from me, for I am a sinful man, O Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he and all who were with him were astonished at the catch of fish that they had taken,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so also were James and John, sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. And Jesus said to Simon, “Do not be afraid; from now on you will be catching men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had brought their boats to land, they left everything and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was in one of the cities, there came a man full of leprosy. And when he saw Jesus, he fell on his face and begged him, “Lord, if you will, you can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him, saying, “I will; be clean.” And immediately the leprosy left him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he charged him to tell no one, but “go and show yourself to the priest, and make an offering for your cleansing, as Moses commanded, for a proof to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now even more the report about him went abroad, and great crowds gathered to hear him and to be healed of their infirmities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he would withdraw to desolate places and pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On one of those days, as he was teaching, Pharisees and teachers of the law were sitting there, who had come from every village of Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem. And the power of the Lord was with him to heal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, some men were bringing on a bed a man who was paralyzed, and they were seeking to bring him in and lay him before Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but finding no way to bring him in, because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and let him down with his bed through the tiles into the midst before Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw their faith, he said, “Man, your sins are forgiven you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to question, saying, “Who is this who speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus perceived their thoughts, he answered them, “Why do you question in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you,’ or to say, ‘Rise and walk’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—he said to the man who was paralyzed—“I say to you, rise, pick up your bed and go home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately he rose up before them and picked up what he had been lying on and went home, glorifying God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And amazement seized them all, and they glorified God and were filled with awe, saying, “We have seen extraordinary things today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this he went out and saw a tax collector named Levi, sitting at the tax booth. And he said to him, “Follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And leaving everything, he rose and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Levi made him a great feast in his house, and there was a large company of tax collectors and others reclining at table with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Pharisees and their scribes grumbled at his disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered them, “Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not come to call the righteous but sinners to repentance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “The disciples of John fast often and offer prayers, and so do the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours eat and drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “Can you make wedding guests fast while the bridegroom is with them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The days will come when the bridegroom is taken away from them, and then they will fast in those days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also told them a parable: “No one tears a piece from a new garment and puts it on an old garment. If he does, he will tear the new, and the piece from the new will not match the old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one puts new wine into old wineskins. If he does, the new wine will burst the skins and it will be spilled, and the skins will be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But new wine must be put into fresh wineskins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one after drinking old wine desires new, for he says, ‘The old is good.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On a Sabbath, while he was going through the grainfields, his disciples plucked and ate some heads of grain, rubbing them in their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of the Pharisees said, “Why are you doing what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered them, “Have you not read what David did when he was hungry, he and those who were with him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how he entered the house of God and took and ate the bread of the Presence, which is not lawful for any but the priests to eat, and also gave it to those with him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “The Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On another Sabbath, he entered the synagogue and was teaching, and a man was there whose right hand was withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scribes and the Pharisees watched him, to see whether he would heal on the Sabbath, so that they might find a reason to accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he knew their thoughts, and he said to the man with the withered hand, “Come and stand here.” And he rose and stood there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “I ask you, is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good or to do harm, to save life or to destroy it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after looking around at them all he said to him, “Stretch out your hand.” And he did so, and his hand was restored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were filled with fury and discussed with one another what they might do to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In these days he went out to the mountain to pray, and all night he continued in prayer to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when day came, he called his disciples and chose from them twelve, whom he named apostles:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon, whom he named Peter, and Andrew his brother, and James and John, and Philip, and Bartholomew,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon who was called the Zealot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Judas the son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came down with them and stood on a level place, with a great crowd of his disciples and a great multitude of people from all Judea and Jerusalem and the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases. And those who were troubled with unclean spirits were cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the crowd sought to touch him, for power came out from him and healed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples, and said:
“Blessed are you who are poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed are you who are hungry now, for you shall be satisfied.
“Blessed are you who weep now, for you shall laugh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Blessed are you when people hate you and when they exclude you and revile you and spurn your name as evil, on account of the Son of Man!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice in that day, and leap for joy, for behold, your reward is great in heaven; for so their fathers did to the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But woe to you who are rich, for you have received your consolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to you who are full now, for you shall be hungry.
“Woe to you who laugh now, for you shall mourn and weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, when all people speak well of you, for so their fathers did to the false prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I say to you who hear, Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: bless those who curse you, pray for those who abuse you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To one who strikes you on the cheek, offer the other also, and from one who takes away your cloak do not withhold your tunic either.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give to everyone who begs from you, and from one who takes away your goods do not demand them back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as you wish that others would do to you, do so to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you love those who love you, what benefit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you do good to those who do good to you, what benefit is that to you? For even sinners do the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you lend to those from whom you expect to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, to get back the same amount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing in return, and your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, for he is kind to the ungrateful and the evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be merciful, even as your Father is merciful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Judge not, and you will not be judged; condemn not, and you will not be condemned; forgive, and you will be forgiven;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: give, and it will be given to you. Good measure, pressed down, shaken together, running over, will be put into your lap. For with the measure you use it will be measured back to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also told them a parable: “Can a blind man lead a blind man? Will they not both fall into a pit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A disciple is not above his teacher, but everyone when he is fully trained will be like his teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you see the speck that is in your brother's eye, but do not notice the log that is in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me take out the speck that is in your eye,’ when you yourself do not see the log that is in your own eye? You hypocrite, first take the log out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to take out the speck that is in your brother's eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For no good tree bears bad fruit, nor again does a bad tree bear good fruit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for each tree is known by its own fruit. For figs are not gathered from thornbushes, nor are grapes picked from a bramble bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The good person out of the good treasure of his heart produces good, and the evil person out of his evil treasure produces evil, for out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you call me ‘Lord, Lord,’ and not do what I tell you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who comes to me and hears my words and does them, I will show you what he is like:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he is like a man building a house, who dug deep and laid the foundation on the rock. And when a flood arose, the stream broke against that house and could not shake it, because it had been well built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who hears and does not do them is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation. When the stream broke against it, immediately it fell, and the ruin of that house was great.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had finished all his sayings in the hearing of the people, he entered Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a centurion had a servant who was sick and at the point of death, who was highly valued by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the centurion heard about Jesus, he sent to him elders of the Jews, asking him to come and heal his servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to Jesus, they pleaded with him earnestly, saying, “He is worthy to have you do this for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he loves our nation, and he is the one who built us our synagogue.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went with them. When he was not far from the house, the centurion sent friends, saying to him, “Lord, do not trouble yourself, for I am not worthy to have you come under my roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I did not presume to come to you. But say the word, and let my servant be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I too am a man set under authority, with soldiers under me: and I say to one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turning to the crowd that followed him, said, “I tell you, not even in Israel have I found such faith.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when those who had been sent returned to the house, they found the servant well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon afterward he went to a town called Nain, and his disciples and a great crowd went with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he drew near to the gate of the town, behold, a man who had died was being carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow, and a considerable crowd from the town was with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her and said to her, “Do not weep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came up and touched the bier, and the bearers stood still. And he said, “Young man, I say to you, arise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the dead man sat up and began to speak, and Jesus gave him to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear seized them all, and they glorified God, saying, “A great prophet has arisen among us!” and “God has visited his people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this report about him spread through the whole of Judea and all the surrounding country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples of John reported all these things to him. And John,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: calling two of his disciples to him, sent them to the Lord, saying, “Are you the one who is to come, or shall we look for another?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the men had come to him, they said, “John the Baptist has sent us to you, saying, ‘Are you the one who is to come, or shall we look for another?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that hour he healed many people of diseases and plagues and evil spirits, and on many who were blind he bestowed sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered them, “Go and tell John what you have seen and heard: the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, the poor have good news preached to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And blessed is the one who is not offended by me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When John's messengers had gone, Jesus began to speak to the crowds concerning John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What then did you go out to see? A man dressed in soft clothing? Behold, those who are dressed in splendid clothing and live in luxury are in kings' courts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What then did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is he of whom it is written,
“‘Behold, I send my messenger before your face,
    who will prepare your way before you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, among those born of women none is greater than John. Yet the one who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (When all the people heard this, and the tax collectors too, they declared God just, having been baptized with the baptism of John,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the Pharisees and the lawyers rejected the purpose of God for themselves, not having been baptized by him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “To what then shall I compare the people of this generation, and what are they like?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: For John the Baptist has come eating no bread and drinking no wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Look at him! A glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet wisdom is justified by all her children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the Pharisees asked him to eat with him, and he went into the Pharisee's house and reclined at table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a woman of the city, who was a sinner, when she learned that he was reclining at table in the Pharisee's house, brought an alabaster flask of ointment,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and standing behind him at his feet, weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears and wiped them with the hair of her head and kissed his feet and anointed them with the ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Pharisee who had invited him saw this, he said to himself, “If this man were a prophet, he would have known who and what sort of woman this is who is touching him, for she is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering said to him, “Simon, I have something to say to you.” And he answered, “Say it, Teacher.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A certain moneylender had two debtors. One owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they could not pay, he cancelled the debt of both. Now which of them will love him more?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon answered, “The one, I suppose, for whom he cancelled the larger debt.” And he said to him, “You have judged rightly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then turning toward the woman he said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I entered your house; you gave me no water for my feet, but she has wet my feet with her tears and wiped them with her hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You gave me no kiss, but from the time I came in she has not ceased to kiss my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You did not anoint my head with oil, but she has anointed my feet with ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I tell you, her sins, which are many, are forgiven—for she loved much. But he who is forgiven little, loves little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those who were at table with him began to say among themselves, “Who is this, who even forgives sins?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you; go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon afterward he went on through cities and villages, proclaiming and bringing the good news of the kingdom of God. And the twelve were with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also some women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary, called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Joanna, the wife of Chuza, Herod's household manager, and Susanna, and many others, who provided for them out of their means.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when a great crowd was gathering and people from town after town came to him, he said in a parable,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A sower went out to sow his seed. And as he sowed, some fell along the path and was trampled underfoot, and the birds of the air devoured it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some fell on the rock, and as it grew up, it withered away, because it had no moisture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up with it and choked it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some fell into good soil and grew and yielded a hundredfold.” As he said these things, he called out, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his disciples asked him what this parable meant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he said, “To you it has been given to know the secrets of the kingdom of God, but for others they are in parables, so that ‘seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ones along the path are those who have heard; then the devil comes and takes away the word from their hearts, so that they may not believe and be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the ones on the rock are those who, when they hear the word, receive it with joy. But these have no root; they believe for a while, and in time of testing fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for what fell among the thorns, they are those who hear, but as they go on their way they are choked by the cares and riches and pleasures of life, and their fruit does not mature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for that in the good soil, they are those who, hearing the word, hold it fast in an honest and good heart, and bear fruit with patience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one after lighting a lamp covers it with a jar or puts it under a bed, but puts it on a stand, so that those who enter may see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nothing is hidden that will not be made manifest, nor is anything secret that will not be known and come to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take care then how you hear, for to the one who has, more will be given, and from the one who has not, even what he thinks that he has will be taken away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his mother and his brothers came to him, but they could not reach him because of the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was told, “Your mother and your brothers are standing outside, desiring to see you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered them, “My mother and my brothers are those who hear the word of God and do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day he got into a boat with his disciples, and he said to them, “Let us go across to the other side of the lake.” So they set out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as they sailed he fell asleep. And a windstorm came down on the lake, and they were filling with water and were in danger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went and woke him, saying, “Master, Master, we are perishing!” And he awoke and rebuked the wind and the raging waves, and they ceased, and there was a calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Where is your faith?” And they were afraid, and they marveled, saying to one another, “Who then is this, that he commands even winds and water, and they obey him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sailed to the country of the Gerasenes, which is opposite Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had stepped out on land, there met him a man from the city who had demons. For a long time he had worn no clothes, and he had not lived in a house but among the tombs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw Jesus, he cried out and fell down before him and said with a loud voice, “What have you to do with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg you, do not torment me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. (For many a time it had seized him. He was kept under guard and bound with chains and shackles, but he would break the bonds and be driven by the demon into the desert.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus then asked him, “What is your name?” And he said, “Legion,” for many demons had entered him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they begged him not to command them to depart into the abyss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a large herd of pigs was feeding there on the hillside, and they begged him to let them enter these. So he gave them permission.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the demons came out of the man and entered the pigs, and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake and drowned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the herdsmen saw what had happened, they fled and told it in the city and in the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then people went out to see what had happened, and they came to Jesus and found the man from whom the demons had gone, sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed and in his right mind, and they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who had seen it told them how the demon-possessed man had been healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people of the surrounding country of the Gerasenes asked him to depart from them, for they were seized with great fear. So he got into the boat and returned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man from whom the demons had gone begged that he might be with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Return to your home, and declare how much God has done for you.” And he went away, proclaiming throughout the whole city how much Jesus had done for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus returned, the crowd welcomed him, for they were all waiting for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came a man named Jairus, who was a ruler of the synagogue. And falling at Jesus' feet, he implored him to come to his house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he had an only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she was dying.
As Jesus went, the people pressed around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a woman who had had a discharge of blood for twelve years, and though she had spent all her living on physicians, she could not be healed by anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She came up behind him and touched the fringe of his garment, and immediately her discharge of blood ceased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, “Who was it that touched me?” When all denied it, Peter said, “Master, the crowds surround you and are pressing in on you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Someone touched me, for I perceive that power has gone out from me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came trembling, and falling down before him declared in the presence of all the people why she had touched him, and how she had been immediately healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well; go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, someone from the ruler's house came and said, “Your daughter is dead; do not trouble the Teacher any more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus on hearing this answered him, “Do not fear; only believe, and she will be well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came to the house, he allowed no one to enter with him, except Peter and John and James, and the father and mother of the child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all were weeping and mourning for her, but he said, “Do not weep, for she is not dead but sleeping.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they laughed at him, knowing that she was dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But taking her by the hand he called, saying, “Child, arise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her spirit returned, and she got up at once. And he directed that something should be given her to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her parents were amazed, but he charged them to tell no one what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called the twelve together and gave them power and authority over all demons and to cure diseases,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he sent them out to proclaim the kingdom of God and to heal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Take nothing for your journey, no staff, nor bag, nor bread, nor money; and do not have two tunics.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever house you enter, stay there, and from there depart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And wherever they do not receive you, when you leave that town shake off the dust from your feet as a testimony against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed and went through the villages, preaching the gospel and healing everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard about all that was happening, and he was perplexed, because it was said by some that John had been raised from the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that one of the prophets of old had risen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod said, “John I beheaded, but who is this about whom I hear such things?” And he sought to see him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On their return the apostles told him all that they had done. And he took them and withdrew apart to a town called Bethsaida.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowds learned it, they followed him, and he welcomed them and spoke to them of the kingdom of God and cured those who had need of healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the day began to wear away, and the twelve came and said to him, “Send the crowd away to go into the surrounding villages and countryside to find lodging and get provisions, for we are here in a desolate place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “You give them something to eat.” They said, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish—unless we are to go and buy food for all these people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there were about five thousand men. And he said to his disciples, “Have them sit down in groups of about fifty each.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did so, and had them all sit down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And taking the five loaves and the two fish, he looked up to heaven and said a blessing over them. Then he broke the loaves and gave them to the disciples to set before the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all ate and were satisfied. And what was left over was picked up, twelve baskets of broken pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that as he was praying alone, the disciples were with him. And he asked them, “Who do the crowds say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they answered, “John the Baptist. But others say, Elijah, and others, that one of the prophets of old has risen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” And Peter answered, “The Christ of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he strictly charged and commanded them to tell this to no one,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “The Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and on the third day be raised.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to all, “If anyone would come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross daily and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever would save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what does it profit a man if he gains the whole world and loses or forfeits himself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever is ashamed of me and of my words, of him will the Son of Man be ashamed when he comes in his glory and the glory of the Father and of the holy angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you truly, there are some standing here who will not taste death until they see the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about eight days after these sayings he took with him Peter and John and James and went up on the mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was praying, the appearance of his face was altered, and his clothing became dazzling white.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, two men were talking with him, Moses and Elijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who appeared in glory and spoke of his departure, which he was about to accomplish at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter and those who were with him were heavy with sleep, but when they became fully awake they saw his glory and the two men who stood with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as the men were parting from him, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good that we are here. Let us make three tents, one for you and one for Moses and one for Elijah”—not knowing what he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was saying these things, a cloud came and overshadowed them, and they were afraid as they entered the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is my Son, my Chosen One; listen to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the voice had spoken, Jesus was found alone. And they kept silent and told no one in those days anything of what they had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day, when they had come down from the mountain, a great crowd met him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a man from the crowd cried out, “Teacher, I beg you to look at my son, for he is my only child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a spirit seizes him, and he suddenly cries out. It convulses him so that he foams at the mouth, and shatters him, and will hardly leave him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I begged your disciples to cast it out, but they could not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “O faithless and twisted generation, how long am I to be with you and bear with you? Bring your son here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was coming, the demon threw him to the ground and convulsed him. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit and healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And all were astonished at the majesty of God.
But while they were all marveling at everything he was doing, Jesus said to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let these words sink into your ears: The Son of Man is about to be delivered into the hands of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not understand this saying, and it was concealed from them, so that they might not perceive it. And they were afraid to ask him about this saying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An argument arose among them as to which of them was the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, knowing the reasoning of their hearts, took a child and put him by his side
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “Whoever receives this child in my name receives me, and whoever receives me receives him who sent me. For he who is least among you all is the one who is great.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered, “Master, we saw someone casting out demons in your name, and we tried to stop him, because he does not follow with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Do not stop him, for the one who is not against you is for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days drew near for him to be taken up, he set his face to go to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent messengers ahead of him, who went and entered a village of the Samaritans, to make preparations for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people did not receive him, because his face was set toward Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his disciples James and John saw it, they said, “Lord, do you want us to tell fire to come down from heaven and consume them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he turned and rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went on to another village.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were going along the road, someone said to him, “I will follow you wherever you go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To another he said, “Follow me.” But he said, “Lord, let me first go and bury my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Leave the dead to bury their own dead. But as for you, go and proclaim the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet another said, “I will follow you, Lord, but let me first say farewell to those at my home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back is fit for the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this the Lord appointed seventy-two others and sent them on ahead of him, two by two, into every town and place where he himself was about to go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “The harvest is plentiful, but the laborers are few. Therefore pray earnestly to the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into his harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go your way; behold, I am sending you out as lambs in the midst of wolves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Carry no moneybag, no knapsack, no sandals, and greet no one on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever house you enter, first say, ‘Peace be to this house!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a son of peace is there, your peace will rest upon him. But if not, it will return to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And remain in the same house, eating and drinking what they provide, for the laborer deserves his wages. Do not go from house to house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you enter a town and they receive you, eat what is set before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heal the sick in it and say to them, ‘The kingdom of God has come near to you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whenever you enter a town and they do not receive you, go into its streets and say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Even the dust of your town that clings to our feet we wipe off against you. Nevertheless know this, that the kingdom of God has come near.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, it will be more bearable on that day for Sodom than for that town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it will be more bearable in the judgment for Tyre and Sidon than for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Capernaum, will you be exalted to heaven? You shall be brought down to Hades.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The one who hears you hears me, and the one who rejects you rejects me, and the one who rejects me rejects him who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventy-two returned with joy, saying, “Lord, even the demons are subject to us in your name!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have given you authority to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy, and nothing shall hurt you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, do not rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that same hour he rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said, “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hidden these things from the wise and understanding and revealed them to little children; yes, Father, for such was your gracious will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things have been handed over to me by my Father, and no one knows who the Son is except the Father, or who the Father is except the Son and anyone to whom the Son chooses to reveal him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then turning to the disciples he said privately, “Blessed are the eyes that see what you see!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you that many prophets and kings desired to see what you see, and did not see it, and to hear what you hear, and did not hear it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a lawyer stood up to put him to the test, saying, “Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “What is written in the Law? How do you read it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered, “You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength and with all your mind, and your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “You have answered correctly; do this, and you will live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he, desiring to justify himself, said to Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “A man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and he fell among robbers, who stripped him and beat him and departed, leaving him half dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now by chance a priest was going down that road, and when he saw him he passed by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So likewise a Levite, when he came to the place and saw him, passed by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a Samaritan, as he journeyed, came to where he was, and when he saw him, he had compassion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went to him and bound up his wounds, pouring on oil and wine. Then he set him on his own animal and brought him to an inn and took care of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the next day he took out two denarii and gave them to the innkeeper, saying, ‘Take care of him, and whatever more you spend, I will repay you when I come back.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of these three, do you think, proved to be a neighbor to the man who fell among the robbers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “The one who showed him mercy.” And Jesus said to him, “You go, and do likewise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as they went on their way, Jesus entered a village. And a woman named Martha welcomed him into her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she had a sister called Mary, who sat at the Lord's feet and listened to his teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Martha was distracted with much serving. And she went up to him and said, “Lord, do you not care that my sister has left me to serve alone? Tell her then to help me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord answered her, “Martha, Martha, you are anxious and troubled about many things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but one thing is necessary. Mary has chosen the good portion, which will not be taken away from her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus was praying in a certain place, and when he finished, one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, as John taught his disciples.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he said to them, “When you pray, say:
“Father, hallowed be your name.
Your kingdom come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give us each day our daily bread,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and forgive us our sins,
    for we ourselves forgive everyone who is indebted to us.
And lead us not into temptation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Which of you who has a friend will go to him at midnight and say to him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for a friend of mine has arrived on a journey, and I have nothing to set before him’;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he will answer from within, ‘Do not bother me; the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed. I cannot get up and give you anything’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, though he will not get up and give him anything because he is his friend, yet because of his impudence he will rise and give him whatever he needs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I tell you, ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everyone who asks receives, and the one who seeks finds, and to the one who knocks it will be opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What father among you, if his son asks for a fish, will instead of a fish give him a serpent;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or if he asks for an egg, will give him a scorpion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you then, who are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will the heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he was casting out a demon that was mute. When the demon had gone out, the mute man spoke, and the people marveled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them said, “He casts out demons by Beelzebul, the prince of demons,”
verses.speaker: Narrator
