verses.text: while others, to test him, kept seeking from him a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he, knowing their thoughts, said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is laid waste, and a divided household falls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I cast out demons by Beelzebul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it is by the finger of God that I cast out demons, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own palace, his goods are safe;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when one stronger than he attacks him and overcomes him, he takes away his armor in which he trusted and divides his spoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever does not gather with me scatters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the unclean spirit has gone out of a person, it passes through waterless places seeking rest, and finding none it says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it comes, it finds the house swept and put in order.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it goes and brings seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they enter and dwell there. And the last state of that person is worse than the first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he said these things, a woman in the crowd raised her voice and said to him, “Blessed is the womb that bore you, and the breasts at which you nursed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “Blessed rather are those who hear the word of God and keep it!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowds were increasing, he began to say, “This generation is an evil generation. It seeks for a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as Jonah became a sign to the people of Nineveh, so will the Son of Man be to this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The queen of the South will rise up at the judgment with the men of this generation and condemn them, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and behold, something greater than Solomon is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Nineveh will rise up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and behold, something greater than Jonah is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one after lighting a lamp puts it in a cellar or under a basket, but on a stand, so that those who enter may see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your eye is the lamp of your body. When your eye is healthy, your whole body is full of light, but when it is bad, your body is full of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore be careful lest the light in you be darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then your whole body is full of light, having no part dark, it will be wholly bright, as when a lamp with its rays gives you light.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was speaking, a Pharisee asked him to dine with him, so he went in and reclined at table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisee was astonished to see that he did not first wash before dinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees cleanse the outside of the cup and of the dish, but inside you are full of greed and wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You fools! Did not he who made the outside make the inside also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But give as alms those things that are within, and behold, everything is clean for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But woe to you Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and every herb, and neglect justice and the love of God. These you ought to have done, without neglecting the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you Pharisees! For you love the best seat in the synagogues and greetings in the marketplaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you! For you are like unmarked graves, and people walk over them without knowing it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the lawyers answered him, “Teacher, in saying these things you insult us also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Woe to you lawyers also! For you load people with burdens hard to bear, and you yourselves do not touch the burdens with one of your fingers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you! For you build the tombs of the prophets whom your fathers killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you are witnesses and you consent to the deeds of your fathers, for they killed them, and you build their tombs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore also the Wisdom of God said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles, some of whom they will kill and persecute,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the blood of all the prophets, shed from the foundation of the world, may be charged against this generation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who perished between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I tell you, it will be required of this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you lawyers! For you have taken away the key of knowledge. You did not enter yourselves, and you hindered those who were entering.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he went away from there, the scribes and the Pharisees began to press him hard and to provoke him to speak about many things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lying in wait for him, to catch him in something he might say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the meantime, when so many thousands of the people had gathered together that they were trampling one another, he began to say to his disciples first, “Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing is covered up that will not be revealed, or hidden that will not be known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore whatever you have said in the dark shall be heard in the light, and what you have whispered in private rooms shall be proclaimed on the housetops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you, my friends, do not fear those who kill the body, and after that have nothing more that they can do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will warn you whom to fear: fear him who, after he has killed, has authority to cast into hell. Yes, I tell you, fear him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are not five sparrows sold for two pennies? And not one of them is forgotten before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why, even the hairs of your head are all numbered. Fear not; you are of more value than many sparrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I tell you, everyone who acknowledges me before men, the Son of Man also will acknowledge before the angels of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the one who denies me before men will be denied before the angels of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but the one who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they bring you before the synagogues and the rulers and the authorities, do not be anxious about how you should defend yourself or what you should say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Holy Spirit will teach you in that very hour what you ought to say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone in the crowd said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to him, “Man, who made me a judge or arbitrator over you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Take care, and be on your guard against all covetousness, for one's life does not consist in the abundance of his possessions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he told them a parable, saying, “The land of a rich man produced plentifully,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he thought to himself, ‘What shall I do, for I have nowhere to store my crops?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, ‘I will do this: I will tear down my barns and build larger ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will say to my soul, “Soul, you have ample goods laid up for many years; relax, eat, drink, be merry.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said to him, ‘Fool! This night your soul is required of you, and the things you have prepared, whose will they be?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So is the one who lays up treasure for himself and is not rich toward God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to his disciples, “Therefore I tell you, do not be anxious about your life, what you will eat, nor about your body, what you will put on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For life is more than food, and the body more than clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider the ravens: they neither sow nor reap, they have neither storehouse nor barn, and yet God feeds them. Of how much more value are you than the birds!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And which of you by being anxious can add a single hour to his span of life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then you are not able to do as small a thing as that, why are you anxious about the rest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider the lilies, how they grow: they neither toil nor spin, yet I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if God so clothes the grass, which is alive in the field today, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, how much more will he clothe you, O you of little faith!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do not seek what you are to eat and what you are to drink, nor be worried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the nations of the world seek after these things, and your Father knows that you need them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, seek his kingdom, and these things will be added to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Fear not, little flock, for it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sell your possessions, and give to the needy. Provide yourselves with moneybags that do not grow old, with a treasure in the heavens that does not fail, where no thief approaches and no moth destroys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Stay dressed for action and keep your lamps burning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and be like men who are waiting for their master to come home from the wedding feast, so that they may open the door to him at once when he comes and knocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are those servants whom the master finds awake when he comes. Truly, I say to you, he will dress himself for service and have them recline at table, and he will come and serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he comes in the second watch, or in the third, and finds them awake, blessed are those servants!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But know this, that if the master of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would not have left his house to be broken into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also must be ready, for the Son of Man is coming at an hour you do not expect.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said, “Lord, are you telling this parable for us or for all?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, “Who then is the faithful and wise manager, whom his master will set over his household, to give them their portion of food at the proper time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is that servant whom his master will find so doing when he comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, I say to you, he will set him over all his possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if that servant says to himself, ‘My master is delayed in coming,’ and begins to beat the male and female servants, and to eat and drink and get drunk,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he does not know, and will cut him in pieces and put him with the unfaithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that servant who knew his master's will but did not get ready or act according to his will, will receive a severe beating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who did not know, and did what deserved a beating, will receive a light beating. Everyone to whom much was given, of him much will be required, and from him to whom they entrusted much, they will demand the more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I came to cast fire on the earth, and would that it were already kindled!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how great is my distress until it is accomplished!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you think that I have come to give peace on earth? No, I tell you, but rather division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For from now on in one house there will be five divided, three against two and two against three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be divided, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also said to the crowds, “When you see a cloud rising in the west, you say at once, ‘A shower is coming.’ And so it happens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you see the south wind blowing, you say, ‘There will be scorching heat,’ and it happens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of earth and sky, but why do you not know how to interpret the present time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And why do you not judge for yourselves what is right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you go with your accuser before the magistrate, make an effort to settle with him on the way, lest he drag you to the judge, and the judge hand you over to the officer, and the officer put you in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, you will never get out until you have paid the very last penny.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were some present at that very time who told him about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered them, “Do you think that these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans, because they suffered in this way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, I tell you; but unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or those eighteen on whom the tower in Siloam fell and killed them: do you think that they were worse offenders than all the others who lived in Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, I tell you; but unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he told this parable: “A man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came seeking fruit on it and found none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to the vinedresser, ‘Look, for three years now I have come seeking fruit on this fig tree, and I find none. Cut it down. Why should it use up the ground?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered him, ‘Sir, let it alone this year also, until I dig around it and put on manure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then if it should bear fruit next year, well and good; but if not, you can cut it down.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a woman who had had a disabling spirit for eighteen years. She was bent over and could not fully straighten herself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw her, he called her over and said to her, “Woman, you are freed from your disability.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he laid his hands on her, and immediately she was made straight, and she glorified God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the ruler of the synagogue, indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, said to the people, “There are six days in which work ought to be done. Come on those days and be healed, and not on the Sabbath day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord answered him, “You hypocrites! Does not each of you on the Sabbath untie his ox or his donkey from the manger and lead it away to water it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ought not this woman, a daughter of Abraham whom Satan bound for eighteen years, be loosed from this bond on the Sabbath day?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he said these things, all his adversaries were put to shame, and all the people rejoiced at all the glorious things that were done by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said therefore, “What is the kingdom of God like? And to what shall I compare it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a grain of mustard seed that a man took and sowed in his garden, and it grew and became a tree, and the birds of the air made nests in its branches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he said, “To what shall I compare the kingdom of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like leaven that a woman took and hid in three measures of flour, until it was all leavened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went on his way through towns and villages, teaching and journeying toward Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And someone said to him, “Lord, will those who are saved be few?” And he said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Strive to enter through the narrow door. For many, I tell you, will seek to enter and will not be able.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When once the master of the house has risen and shut the door, and you begin to stand outside and to knock at the door, saying, ‘Lord, open to us,’ then he will answer you, ‘I do not know where you come from.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught in our streets.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he will say, ‘I tell you, I do not know where you come from. Depart from me, all you workers of evil!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when you see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God but you yourselves cast out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And people will come from east and west, and from north and south, and recline at table in the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, some are last who will be first, and some are first who will be last.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that very hour some Pharisees came and said to him, “Get away from here, for Herod wants to kill you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘Behold, I cast out demons and perform cures today and tomorrow, and the third day I finish my course.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, I must go on my way today and tomorrow and the day following, for it cannot be that a prophet should perish away from Jerusalem.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, the city that kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to it! How often would I have gathered your children together as a hen gathers her brood under her wings, and you were not willing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, your house is forsaken. And I tell you, you will not see me until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One Sabbath, when he went to dine at the house of a ruler of the Pharisees, they were watching him carefully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a man before him who had dropsy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus responded to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath, or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they remained silent. Then he took him and healed him and sent him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Which of you, having a son or an ox that has fallen into a well on a Sabbath day, will not immediately pull him out?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they could not reply to these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he told a parable to those who were invited, when he noticed how they chose the places of honor, saying to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you are invited by someone to a wedding feast, do not sit down in a place of honor, lest someone more distinguished than you be invited by him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he who invited you both will come and say to you, ‘Give your place to this person,’ and then you will begin with shame to take the lowest place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you are invited, go and sit in the lowest place, so that when your host comes he may say to you, ‘Friend, move up higher.’ Then you will be honored in the presence of all who sit at table with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said also to the man who had invited him, “When you give a dinner or a banquet, do not invite your friends or your brothers or your relatives or rich neighbors, lest they also invite you in return and you be repaid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you give a feast, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, the blind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you will be blessed, because they cannot repay you. For you will be repaid at the resurrection of the just.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When one of those who reclined at table with him heard these things, he said to him, “Blessed is everyone who will eat bread in the kingdom of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to him, “A man once gave a great banquet and invited many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the time for the banquet he sent his servant to say to those who had been invited, ‘Come, for everything is now ready.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they all alike began to make excuses. The first said to him, ‘I have bought a field, and I must go out and see it. Please have me excused.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another said, ‘I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I go to examine them. Please have me excused.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another said, ‘I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the servant came and reported these things to his master. Then the master of the house became angry and said to his servant, ‘Go out quickly to the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in the poor and crippled and blind and lame.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servant said, ‘Sir, what you commanded has been done, and still there is room.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the master said to the servant, ‘Go out to the highways and hedges and compel people to come in, that my house may be filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you, none of those men who were invited shall taste my banquet.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now great crowds accompanied him, and he turned and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone comes to me and does not hate his own father and mother and wife and children and brothers and sisters, yes, and even his own life, he cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever does not bear his own cross and come after me cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For which of you, desiring to build a tower, does not first sit down and count the cost, whether he has enough to complete it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, when he has laid a foundation and is not able to finish, all who see it begin to mock him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘This man began to build and was not able to finish.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or what king, going out to encounter another king in war, will not sit down first and deliberate whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him who comes against him with twenty thousand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if not, while the other is yet a great way off, he sends a delegation and asks for terms of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So therefore, any one of you who does not renounce all that he has cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Salt is good, but if salt has lost its taste, how shall its saltiness be restored?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is of no use either for the soil or for the manure pile. It is thrown away. He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the tax collectors and sinners were all drawing near to hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Pharisees and the scribes grumbled, saying, “This man receives sinners and eats with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he told them this parable:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What man of you, having a hundred sheep, if he has lost one of them, does not leave the ninety-nine in the open country, and go after the one that is lost, until he finds it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he has found it, he lays it on his shoulders, rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he comes home, he calls together his friends and his neighbors, saying to them, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep that was lost.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just so, I tell you, there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous persons who need no repentance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Or what woman, having ten silver coins, if she loses one coin, does not light a lamp and sweep the house and seek diligently until she finds it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the coin that I had lost.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just so, I tell you, there is joy before the angels of God over one sinner who repents.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “There was a man who had two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me the share of property that is coming to me.’ And he divided his property between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not many days later, the younger son gathered all he had and took a journey into a far country, and there he squandered his property in reckless living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had spent everything, a severe famine arose in that country, and he began to be in need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went and hired himself out to one of the citizens of that country, who sent him into his fields to feed pigs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was longing to be fed with the pods that the pigs ate, and no one gave him anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when he came to himself, he said, ‘How many of my father's hired servants have more than enough bread, but I perish here with hunger!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will arise and go to my father, and I will say to him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven and before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am no longer worthy to be called your son. Treat me as one of your hired servants.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he arose and came to his father. But while he was still a long way off, his father saw him and felt compassion, and ran and embraced him and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and before you. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the father said to his servants, ‘Bring quickly the best robe, and put it on him, and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And bring the fattened calf and kill it, and let us eat and celebrate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found.’ And they began to celebrate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now his older son was in the field, and as he came and drew near to the house, he heard music and dancing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called one of the servants and asked what these things meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, ‘Your brother has come, and your father has killed the fattened calf, because he has received him back safe and sound.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he was angry and refused to go in. His father came out and entreated him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he answered his father, ‘Look, these many years I have served you, and I never disobeyed your command, yet you never gave me a young goat, that I might celebrate with my friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when this son of yours came, who has devoured your property with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that is mine is yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was fitting to celebrate and be glad, for this your brother was dead, and is alive; he was lost, and is found.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also said to the disciples, “There was a rich man who had a manager, and charges were brought to him that this man was wasting his possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called him and said to him, ‘What is this that I hear about you? Turn in the account of your management, for you can no longer be manager.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the manager said to himself, ‘What shall I do, since my master is taking the management away from me? I am not strong enough to dig, and I am ashamed to beg.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have decided what to do, so that when I am removed from management, people may receive me into their houses.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, summoning his master's debtors one by one, he said to the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, ‘A hundred measures of oil.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and sit down quickly and write fifty.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to another, ‘And how much do you owe?’ He said, ‘A hundred measures of wheat.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and write eighty.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The master commended the dishonest manager for his shrewdness. For the sons of this world are more shrewd in dealing with their own generation than the sons of light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I tell you, make friends for yourselves by means of unrighteous wealth, so that when it fails they may receive you into the eternal dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “One who is faithful in a very little is also faithful in much, and one who is dishonest in a very little is also dishonest in much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then you have not been faithful in the unrighteous wealth, who will entrust to you the true riches?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you have not been faithful in that which is another's, who will give you that which is your own?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No servant can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees, who were lovers of money, heard all these things, and they ridiculed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “You are those who justify yourselves before men, but God knows your hearts. For what is exalted among men is an abomination in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Law and the Prophets were until John; since then the good news of the kingdom of God is preached, and everyone forces his way into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for one dot of the Law to become void.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Everyone who divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery, and he who marries a woman divorced from her husband commits adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There was a rich man who was clothed in purple and fine linen and who feasted sumptuously every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at his gate was laid a poor man named Lazarus, covered with sores,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who desired to be fed with what fell from the rich man's table. Moreover, even the dogs came and licked his sores.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poor man died and was carried by the angels to Abraham's side. The rich man also died and was buried,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in Hades, being in torment, he lifted up his eyes and saw Abraham far off and Lazarus at his side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called out, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus to dip the end of his finger in water and cool my tongue, for I am in anguish in this flame.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abraham said, ‘Child, remember that you in your lifetime received your good things, and Lazarus in like manner bad things; but now he is comforted here, and you are in anguish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And besides all this, between us and you a great chasm has been fixed, in order that those who would pass from here to you may not be able, and none may cross from there to us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, ‘Then I beg you, father, to send him to my father's house—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have five brothers—so that he may warn them, lest they also come into this place of torment.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abraham said, ‘They have Moses and the Prophets; let them hear them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, ‘No, father Abraham, but if someone goes to them from the dead, they will repent.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, ‘If they do not hear Moses and the Prophets, neither will they be convinced if someone should rise from the dead.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to his disciples, “Temptations to sin are sure to come, but woe to the one through whom they come!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck and he were cast into the sea than that he should cause one of these little ones to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pay attention to yourselves! If your brother sins, rebuke him, and if he repents, forgive him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if he sins against you seven times in the day, and turns to you seven times, saying, ‘I repent,’ you must forgive him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, “If you had faith like a grain of mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, ‘Be uprooted and planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Will any one of you who has a servant plowing or keeping sheep say to him when he has come in from the field, ‘Come at once and recline at table’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will he not rather say to him, ‘Prepare supper for me, and dress properly, and serve me while I eat and drink, and afterward you will eat and drink’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does he thank the servant because he did what was commanded?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you also, when you have done all that you were commanded, say, ‘We are unworthy servants; we have only done what was our duty.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the way to Jerusalem he was passing along between Samaria and Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he entered a village, he was met by ten lepers, who stood at a distance
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lifted up their voices, saying, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw them he said to them, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.” And as they went they were cleansed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, praising God with a loud voice;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he fell on his face at Jesus' feet, giving him thanks. Now he was a Samaritan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered, “Were not ten cleansed? Where are the nine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was no one found to return and give praise to God except this foreigner?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “Rise and go your way; your faith has made you well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Being asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come, he answered them, “The kingdom of God is not coming in ways that can be observed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor will they say, ‘Look, here it is!’ or ‘There!’ for behold, the kingdom of God is in the midst of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to the disciples, “The days are coming when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will say to you, ‘Look, there!’ or ‘Look, here!’ Do not go out or follow them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the lightning flashes and lights up the sky from one side to the other, so will the Son of Man be in his day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But first he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as it was in the days of Noah, so will it be in the days of the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were eating and drinking and marrying and being given in marriage, until the day when Noah entered the ark, and the flood came and destroyed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, just as it was in the days of Lot—they were eating and drinking, buying and selling, planting and building,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but on the day when Lot went out from Sodom, fire and sulfur rained from heaven and destroyed them all—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so will it be on the day when the Son of Man is revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day, let the one who is on the housetop, with his goods in the house, not come down to take them away, and likewise let the one who is in the field not turn back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Lot's wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever seeks to preserve his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life will keep it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, in that night there will be two in one bed. One will be taken and the other left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be two women grinding together. One will be taken and the other left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “Where, Lord?” He said to them, “Where the corpse is, there the vultures will gather.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he told them a parable to the effect that they ought always to pray and not lose heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “In a certain city there was a judge who neither feared God nor respected man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a widow in that city who kept coming to him and saying, ‘Give me justice against my adversary.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a while he refused, but afterward he said to himself, ‘Though I neither fear God nor respect man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet because this widow keeps bothering me, I will give her justice, so that she will not beat me down by her continual coming.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, “Hear what the unrighteous judge says.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And will not God give justice to his elect, who cry to him day and night? Will he delay long over them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, he will give justice to them speedily. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on earth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also told this parable to some who trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and treated others with contempt:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Two men went up into the temple to pray, one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisee, standing by himself, prayed thus: ‘God, I thank you that I am not like other men, extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even like this tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I fast twice a week; I give tithes of all that I get.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the tax collector, standing far off, would not even lift up his eyes to heaven, but beat his breast, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me, a sinner!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, this man went down to his house justified, rather than the other. For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but the one who humbles himself will be exalted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they were bringing even infants to him that he might touch them. And when the disciples saw it, they rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus called them to him, saying, “Let the children come to me, and do not hinder them, for to such belongs the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a child shall not enter it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a ruler asked him, “Good Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good except God alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the commandments: ‘Do not commit adultery, Do not murder, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Honor your father and mother.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “All these I have kept from my youth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard this, he said to him, “One thing you still lack. Sell all that you have and distribute to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he heard these things, he became very sad, for he was extremely rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, seeing that he had become sad, said, “How difficult it is for those who have wealth to enter the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who heard it said, “Then who can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “What is impossible with man is possible with God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said, “See, we have left our homes and followed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Truly, I say to you, there is no one who has left house or wife or brothers or parents or children, for the sake of the kingdom of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who will not receive many times more in this time, and in the age to come eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And taking the twelve, he said to them, “See, we are going up to Jerusalem, and everything that is written about the Son of Man by the prophets will be accomplished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he will be delivered over to the Gentiles and will be mocked and shamefully treated and spit upon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after flogging him, they will kill him, and on the third day he will rise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they understood none of these things. This saying was hidden from them, and they did not grasp what was said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he drew near to Jericho, a blind man was sitting by the roadside begging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And hearing a crowd going by, he inquired what this meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him, “Jesus of Nazareth is passing by.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he cried out, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who were in front rebuked him, telling him to be silent. But he cried out all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus stopped and commanded him to be brought to him. And when he came near, he asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you want me to do for you?” He said, “Lord, let me recover my sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Recover your sight; your faith has made you well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately he recovered his sight and followed him, glorifying God. And all the people, when they saw it, gave praise to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He entered Jericho and was passing through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a man named Zacchaeus. He was a chief tax collector and was rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was seeking to see who Jesus was, but on account of the crowd he could not, because he was small in stature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he ran on ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see him, for he was about to pass that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus came to the place, he looked up and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down, for I must stay at your house today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he hurried and came down and received him joyfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they saw it, they all grumbled, “He has gone in to be the guest of a man who is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, “Behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor. And if I have defrauded anyone of anything, I restore it fourfold.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Today salvation has come to this house, since he also is a son of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they heard these things, he proceeded to tell a parable, because he was near to Jerusalem, and because they supposed that the kingdom of God was to appear immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said therefore, “A nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom and then return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Calling ten of his servants, he gave them ten minas, and said to them, ‘Engage in business until I come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his citizens hated him and sent a delegation after him, saying, ‘We do not want this man to reign over us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he returned, having received the kingdom, he ordered these servants to whom he had given the money to be called to him, that he might know what they had gained by doing business.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first came before him, saying, ‘Lord, your mina has made ten minas more.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, ‘Well done, good servant! Because you have been faithful in a very little, you shall have authority over ten cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the second came, saying, ‘Lord, your mina has made five minas.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, ‘And you are to be over five cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then another came, saying, ‘Lord, here is your mina, which I kept laid away in a handkerchief;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I was afraid of you, because you are a severe man. You take what you did not deposit, and reap what you did not sow.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, ‘I will condemn you with your own words, you wicked servant! You knew that I was a severe man, taking what I did not deposit and reaping what I did not sow?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why then did you not put my money in the bank, and at my coming I might have collected it with interest?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to those who stood by, ‘Take the mina from him, and give it to the one who has the ten minas.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, ‘Lord, he has ten minas!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I tell you that to everyone who has, more will be given, but from the one who has not, even what he has will be taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for these enemies of mine, who did not want me to reign over them, bring them here and slaughter them before me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had said these things, he went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he drew near to Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount that is called Olivet, he sent two of the disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Go into the village in front of you, where on entering you will find a colt tied, on which no one has ever yet sat. Untie it and bring it here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ you shall say this: ‘The Lord has need of it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So those who were sent went away and found it just as he had told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were untying the colt, its owners said to them, “Why are you untying the colt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “The Lord has need of it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought it to Jesus, and throwing their cloaks on the colt, they set Jesus on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he rode along, they spread their cloaks on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was drawing near—already on the way down the Mount of Olives—the whole multitude of his disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the Lord! Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of the Pharisees in the crowd said to him, “Teacher, rebuke your disciples.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “I tell you, if these were silent, the very stones would cry out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he drew near and saw the city, he wept over it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Would that you, even you, had known on this day the things that make for peace! But now they are hidden from your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the days will come upon you, when your enemies will set up a barricade around you and surround you and hem you in on every side
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and tear you down to the ground, you and your children within you. And they will not leave one stone upon another in you, because you did not know the time of your visitation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he entered the temple and began to drive out those who sold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to them, “It is written, ‘My house shall be a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a den of robbers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was teaching daily in the temple. The chief priests and the scribes and the principal men of the people were seeking to destroy him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they did not find anything they could do, for all the people were hanging on his words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day, as Jesus was teaching the people in the temple and preaching the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes with the elders came up
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, “Tell us by what authority you do these things, or who it is that gave you this authority.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “I also will ask you a question. Now tell me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: was the baptism of John from heaven or from man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they discussed it with one another, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why did you not believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From man,’ all the people will stone us to death, for they are convinced that John was a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they answered that they did not know where it came from.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to tell the people this parable: “A man planted a vineyard and let it out to tenants and went into another country for a long while.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the time came, he sent a servant to the tenants, so that they would give him some of the fruit of the vineyard. But the tenants beat him and sent him away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent another servant. But they also beat and treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent yet a third. This one also they wounded and cast out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the owner of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son; perhaps they will respect him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the tenants saw him, they said to themselves, ‘This is the heir. Let us kill him, so that the inheritance may be ours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. What then will the owner of the vineyard do to them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will come and destroy those tenants and give the vineyard to others.” When they heard this, they said, “Surely not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he looked directly at them and said, “What then is this that is written:
“‘The stone that the builders rejected
    has become the cornerstone’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces, and when it falls on anyone, it will crush him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scribes and the chief priests sought to lay hands on him at that very hour, for they perceived that he had told this parable against them, but they feared the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they watched him and sent spies, who pretended to be sincere, that they might catch him in something he said, so as to deliver him up to the authority and jurisdiction of the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they asked him, “Teacher, we know that you speak and teach rightly, and show no partiality, but truly teach the way of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it lawful for us to give tribute to Caesar, or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he perceived their craftiness, and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Show me a denarius. Whose likeness and inscription does it have?” They said, “Caesar's.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Then render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were not able in the presence of the people to catch him in what he said, but marveling at his answer they became silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There came to him some Sadducees, those who deny that there is a resurrection,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they asked him a question, saying, “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man's brother dies, having a wife but no children, the man must take the widow and raise up offspring for his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were seven brothers. The first took a wife, and died without children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the second
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the third took her, and likewise all seven left no children and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward the woman also died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the resurrection, therefore, whose wife will the woman be? For the seven had her as wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “The sons of this age marry and are given in marriage,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but those who are considered worthy to attain to that age and to the resurrection from the dead neither marry nor are given in marriage,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they cannot die anymore, because they are equal to angels and are sons of God, being sons of the resurrection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that the dead are raised, even Moses showed, in the passage about the bush, where he calls the Lord the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he is not God of the dead, but of the living, for all live to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the scribes answered, “Teacher, you have spoken well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they no longer dared to ask him any question.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “How can they say that the Christ is David's son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For David himself says in the Book of Psalms,
“‘The Lord said to my Lord,
“Sit at my right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until I make your enemies your footstool.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David thus calls him Lord, so how is he his son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the hearing of all the people he said to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Beware of the scribes, who like to walk around in long robes, and love greetings in the marketplaces and the best seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at feasts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who devour widows' houses and for a pretense make long prayers. They will receive the greater condemnation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked up and saw the rich putting their gifts into the offering box,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saw a poor widow put in two small copper coins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Truly, I tell you, this poor widow has put in more than all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they all contributed out of their abundance, but she out of her poverty put in all she had to live on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while some were speaking of the temple, how it was adorned with noble stones and offerings, he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for these things that you see, the days will come when there will not be left here one stone upon another that will not be thrown down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked him, “Teacher, when will these things be, and what will be the sign when these things are about to take place?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “See that you are not led astray. For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he!’ and, ‘The time is at hand!’ Do not go after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you hear of wars and tumults, do not be terrified, for these things must first take place, but the end will not be at once.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be great earthquakes, and in various places famines and pestilences. And there will be terrors and great signs from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But before all this they will lay their hands on you and persecute you, delivering you up to the synagogues and prisons, and you will be brought before kings and governors for my name's sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This will be your opportunity to bear witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Settle it therefore in your minds not to meditate beforehand how to answer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I will give you a mouth and wisdom, which none of your adversaries will be able to withstand or contradict.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be delivered up even by parents and brothers and relatives and friends, and some of you they will put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be hated by all for my name's sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But not a hair of your head will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By your endurance you will gain your lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its desolation has come near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains, and let those who are inside the city depart, and let not those who are out in the country enter it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for these are days of vengeance, to fulfill all that is written.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Alas for women who are pregnant and for those who are nursing infants in those days! For there will be great distress upon the earth and wrath against this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will fall by the edge of the sword and be led captive among all nations, and Jerusalem will be trampled underfoot by the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And there will be signs in sun and moon and stars, and on the earth distress of nations in perplexity because of the roaring of the sea and the waves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: people fainting with fear and with foreboding of what is coming on the world. For the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when these things begin to take place, straighten up and raise your heads, because your redemption is drawing near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he told them a parable: “Look at the fig tree, and all the trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as they come out in leaf, you see for yourselves and know that the summer is already near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also, when you see these things taking place, you know that the kingdom of God is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all has taken place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But watch yourselves lest your hearts be weighed down with dissipation and drunkenness and cares of this life, and that day come upon you suddenly like a trap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it will come upon all who dwell on the face of the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But stay awake at all times, praying that you may have strength to escape all these things that are going to take place, and to stand before the Son of Man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every day he was teaching in the temple, but at night he went out and lodged on the mount called Olivet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And early in the morning all the people came to him in the temple to hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Feast of Unleavened Bread drew near, which is called the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief priests and the scribes were seeking how to put him to death, for they feared the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Satan entered into Judas called Iscariot, who was of the number of the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went away and conferred with the chief priests and officers how he might betray him to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were glad, and agreed to give him money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he consented and sought an opportunity to betray him to them in the absence of a crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the day of Unleavened Bread, on which the Passover lamb had to be sacrificed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us, that we may eat it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Where will you have us prepare it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Behold, when you have entered the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him into the house that he enters
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and tell the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will show you a large upper room furnished; prepare it there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went and found it just as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the hour came, he reclined at table, and the apostles with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you I will not eat it until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took a cup, and when he had given thanks he said, “Take this, and divide it among yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you that from now on I will not drink of the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God comes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke it and gave it to them, saying, “This is my body, which is given for you. Do this in remembrance of me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And likewise the cup after they had eaten, saying, “This cup that is poured out for you is the new covenant in my blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But behold, the hand of him who betrays me is with me on the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man goes as it has been determined, but woe to that man by whom he is betrayed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began to question one another, which of them it could be who was going to do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A dispute also arose among them, as to which of them was to be regarded as the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them, and those in authority over them are called benefactors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But not so with you. Rather, let the greatest among you become as the youngest, and the leader as one who serves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who is the greater, one who reclines at table or one who serves? Is it not the one who reclines at table? But I am among you as the one who serves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are those who have stayed with me in my trials,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I assign to you, as my Father assigned to me, a kingdom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Simon, Simon, behold, Satan demanded to have you, that he might sift you like wheat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I have prayed for you that your faith may not fail. And when you have turned again, strengthen your brothers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to him, “Lord, I am ready to go with you both to prison and to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “I tell you, Peter, the rooster will not crow this day, until you deny three times that you know me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “When I sent you out with no moneybag or knapsack or sandals, did you lack anything?” They said, “Nothing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “But now let the one who has a moneybag take it, and likewise a knapsack. And let the one who has no sword sell his cloak and buy one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you that this Scripture must be fulfilled in me: ‘And he was numbered with the transgressors.’ For what is written about me has its fulfillment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Look, Lord, here are two swords.” And he said to them, “It is enough.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came out and went, as was his custom, to the Mount of Olives, and the disciples followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came to the place, he said to them, “Pray that you may not enter into temptation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he withdrew from them about a stone's throw, and knelt down and prayed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Father, if you are willing, remove this cup from me. Nevertheless, not my will, but yours, be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there appeared to him an angel from heaven, strengthening him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And being in agony he prayed more earnestly; and his sweat became like great drops of blood falling down to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he rose from prayer, he came to the disciples and found them sleeping for sorrow,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Rise and pray that you may not enter into temptation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, there came a crowd, and the man called Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them. He drew near to Jesus to kiss him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but Jesus said to him, “Judas, would you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when those who were around him saw what would follow, they said, “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of them struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his right ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “No more of this!” And he touched his ear and healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the chief priests and officers of the temple and elders, who had come out against him, “Have you come out as against a robber, with swords and clubs?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I was with you day after day in the temple, you did not lay hands on me. But this is your hour, and the power of darkness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they seized him and led him away, bringing him into the high priest's house, and Peter was following at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and sat down together, Peter sat down among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a servant girl, seeing him as he sat in the light and looking closely at him, said, “This man also was with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it, saying, “Woman, I do not know him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a little later someone else saw him and said, “You also are one of them.” But Peter said, “Man, I am not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after an interval of about an hour still another insisted, saying, “Certainly this man also was with him, for he too is a Galilean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, “Man, I do not know what you are talking about.” And immediately, while he was still speaking, the rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord turned and looked at Peter. And Peter remembered the saying of the Lord, how he had said to him, “Before the rooster crows today, you will deny me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went out and wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the men who were holding Jesus in custody were mocking him as they beat him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also blindfolded him and kept asking him, “Prophesy! Who is it that struck you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said many other things against him, blaspheming him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When day came, the assembly of the elders of the people gathered together, both chief priests and scribes. And they led him away to their council, and they said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you are the Christ, tell us.” But he said to them, “If I tell you, you will not believe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if I ask you, you will not answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from now on the Son of Man shall be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they all said, “Are you the Son of God, then?” And he said to them, “You say that I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “What further testimony do we need? We have heard it ourselves from his own lips.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the whole company of them arose and brought him before Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began to accuse him, saying, “We found this man misleading our nation and forbidding us to give tribute to Caesar, and saying that he himself is Christ, a king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?” And he answered him, “You have said so.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said to the chief priests and the crowds, “I find no guilt in this man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were urgent, saying, “He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, from Galilee even to this place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard this, he asked whether the man was a Galilean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he learned that he belonged to Herod's jurisdiction, he sent him over to Herod, who was himself in Jerusalem at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod saw Jesus, he was very glad, for he had long desired to see him, because he had heard about him, and he was hoping to see some sign done by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he questioned him at some length, but he made no answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the scribes stood by, vehemently accusing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Herod with his soldiers treated him with contempt and mocked him. Then, arraying him in splendid clothing, he sent him back to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Herod and Pilate became friends with each other that very day, for before this they had been at enmity with each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate then called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “You brought me this man as one who was misleading the people. And after examining him before you, behold, I did not find this man guilty of any of your charges against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither did Herod, for he sent him back to us. Look, nothing deserving death has been done by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will therefore punish and release him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they all cried out together, “Away with this man, and release to us Barabbas”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a man who had been thrown into prison for an insurrection started in the city and for murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate addressed them once more, desiring to release Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they kept shouting, “Crucify, crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A third time he said to them, “Why? What evil has he done? I have found in him no guilt deserving death. I will therefore punish and release him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were urgent, demanding with loud cries that he should be crucified. And their voices prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate decided that their demand should be granted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He released the man who had been thrown into prison for insurrection and murder, for whom they asked, but he delivered Jesus over to their will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they led him away, they seized one Simon of Cyrene, who was coming in from the country, and laid on him the cross, to carry it behind Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator
