verses.text: And there followed him a great multitude of the people and of women who were mourning and lamenting for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But turning to them Jesus said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, the days are coming when they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren and the wombs that never bore and the breasts that never nursed!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us,’ and to the hills, ‘Cover us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if they do these things when the wood is green, what will happen when it is dry?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two others, who were criminals, were led away to be put to death with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to the place that is called The Skull, there they crucified him, and the criminals, one on his right and one on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they know not what they do.” And they cast lots to divide his garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people stood by, watching, but the rulers scoffed at him, saying, “He saved others; let him save himself, if he is the Christ of God, his Chosen One!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers also mocked him, coming up and offering him sour wine
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “If you are the King of the Jews, save yourself!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was also an inscription over him, “This is the King of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the criminals who were hanged railed at him, saying, “Are you not the Christ? Save yourself and us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the other rebuked him, saying, “Do you not fear God, since you are under the same sentence of condemnation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we indeed justly, for we are receiving the due reward of our deeds; but this man has done nothing wrong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Jesus, remember me when you come into your kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “Truly, I say to you, today you will be with me in paradise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was now about the sixth hour, and there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while the sun's light failed. And the curtain of the temple was torn in two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, calling out with a loud voice, said, “Father, into your hands I commit my spirit!” And having said this he breathed his last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the centurion saw what had taken place, he praised God, saying, “Certainly this man was innocent!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the crowds that had assembled for this spectacle, when they saw what had taken place, returned home beating their breasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all his acquaintances and the women who had followed him from Galilee stood at a distance watching these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a man named Joseph, from the Jewish town of Arimathea. He was a member of the council, a good and righteous man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who had not consented to their decision and action; and he was looking for the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took it down and wrapped it in a linen shroud and laid him in a tomb cut in stone, where no one had ever yet been laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the day of Preparation, and the Sabbath was beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The women who had come with him from Galilee followed and saw the tomb and how his body was laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they returned and prepared spices and ointments.
On the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the first day of the week, at early dawn, they went to the tomb, taking the spices they had prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they found the stone rolled away from the tomb,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when they went in they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were perplexed about this, behold, two men stood by them in dazzling apparel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were frightened and bowed their faces to the ground, the men said to them, “Why do you seek the living among the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not here, but has risen. Remember how he told you, while he was still in Galilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men and be crucified and on the third day rise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they remembered his words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and returning from the tomb they told all these things to the eleven and to all the rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was Mary Magdalene and Joanna and Mary the mother of James and the other women with them who told these things to the apostles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but these words seemed to them an idle tale, and they did not believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter rose and ran to the tomb; stooping and looking in, he saw the linen cloths by themselves; and he went home marveling at what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That very day two of them were going to a village named Emmaus, about seven miles from Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were talking with each other about all these things that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were talking and discussing together, Jesus himself drew near and went with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their eyes were kept from recognizing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “What is this conversation that you are holding with each other as you walk?” And they stood still, looking sad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of them, named Cleopas, answered him, “Are you the only visitor to Jerusalem who does not know the things that have happened there in these days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “What things?” And they said to him, “Concerning Jesus of Nazareth, a man who was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and how our chief priests and rulers delivered him up to be condemned to death, and crucified him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we had hoped that he was the one to redeem Israel. Yes, and besides all this, it is now the third day since these things happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, some women of our company amazed us. They were at the tomb early in the morning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they did not find his body, they came back saying that they had even seen a vision of angels, who said that he was alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of those who were with us went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said, but him they did not see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “O foolish ones, and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was it not necessary that the Christ should suffer these things and enter into his glory?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And beginning with Moses and all the Prophets, he interpreted to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they drew near to the village to which they were going. He acted as if he were going farther,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they urged him strongly, saying, “Stay with us, for it is toward evening and the day is now far spent.” So he went in to stay with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was at table with them, he took the bread and blessed and broke it and gave it to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their eyes were opened, and they recognized him. And he vanished from their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to each other, “Did not our hearts burn within us while he talked to us on the road, while he opened to us the Scriptures?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they rose that same hour and returned to Jerusalem. And they found the eleven and those who were with them gathered together,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “The Lord has risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they told what had happened on the road, and how he was known to them in the breaking of the bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were talking about these things, Jesus himself stood among them, and said to them, “Peace to you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were startled and frightened and thought they saw a spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Why are you troubled, and why do doubts arise in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See my hands and my feet, that it is I myself. Touch me, and see. For a spirit does not have flesh and bones as you see that I have.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had said this, he showed them his hands and his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they still disbelieved for joy and were marveling, he said to them, “Have you anything here to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave him a piece of broiled fish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he took it and ate before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “These are my words that I spoke to you while I was still with you, that everything written about me in the Law of Moses and the Prophets and the Psalms must be fulfilled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he opened their minds to understand the Scriptures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “Thus it is written, that the Christ should suffer and on the third day rise from the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that repentance for the forgiveness of sins should be proclaimed in his name to all nations, beginning from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are witnesses of these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, I am sending the promise of my Father upon you. But stay in the city until you are clothed with power from on high.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he led them out as far as Bethany, and lifting up his hands he blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he blessed them, he parted from them and was carried up into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they worshiped him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and were continually in the temple blessing God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
